stem: For each finding, click to specify if the finding is consistent with Improvement, Decline, or No Change in the patient's respiratory status.

medicalHistory: History of tobacco use (quit 5 years ago)

itemContext.sbar: Patient is a 68-year-old male with COPD admitted 3 days ago for an exacerbation. He was initially placed on BiPAP and has been weaning to nasal cannula. He's complaining of increased shortness of breath this morning.

rationale.correct: Rationale for correctly categorizing the finding as indicative of Improvement, Decline, or No Change.
rationale.incorrect: Rationale for why categorizing the finding incorrectly is wrong.
clinicalPearls: Understanding the typical progression of COPD exacerbations is crucial.
Monitor trends in vital signs and ABGs, not just single values.
Consider the patient's baseline respiratory status when interpreting findings.

questionTrap.distraction: Findings can be misleading if considered in isolation without the context of the patient's overall condition and treatment plan.
questionTrap.cognitiveBias: Availability heuristic - relying too heavily on recent data points without considering the overall trend.

matrixMatch.rationaleImprovement: Decreased wheezing suggests improved airflow and reduced bronchospasm, indicating improvement.
matrixMatch.rationaleDecline: Wheezing typically indicates airway narrowing. An increase would suggest decline.
matrixMatch.rationaleNoChange: Wheezing remaining at the same level would indicate no change.

matrixMatch.finding: SpO2 increasing from 88% to 92% on 2L nasal cannula
matrixMatch.rationaleImprovement: Increased SpO2 indicates better oxygenation, suggesting improvement.
matrixMatch.rationaleDecline: A decreasing SpO2 would indicate worsening oxygenation.
matrixMatch.rationaleNoChange: Maintaining the same SpO2 level would indicate no change.

matrixMatch.rationaleImprovement: Decreased use of accessory muscles indicates improvement in respiratory effort.
matrixMatch.rationaleDecline: Increased use of accessory muscles indicates increased work of breathing and respiratory distress.
matrixMatch.rationaleNoChange: Maintaining the same level of accessory muscle use would indicate no change.

matrixMatch.finding: Patient reports feeling more short of breath
matrixMatch.rationaleImprovement: Patient reports feeling less short of breath indicates improvement.
matrixMatch.rationaleDecline: Increased shortness of breath indicates worsening respiratory status.
matrixMatch.rationaleNoChange: Patient reporting the same level of shortness of breath indicates no change.

matrixMatch.rationaleImprovement: Respiratory rate decreasing towards normal (12-20) indicates improvement.
matrixMatch.rationaleDecline: Respiratory rate increasing further indicates worsening respiratory distress.
matrixMatch.rationaleNoChange: Respiratory rate remaining the same indicates no change.

matrixMatch.rationaleImprovement: Increased level of consciousness indicates improvement in oxygenation to the brain.
matrixMatch.rationaleDecline: Decreased level of consciousness indicates worsening oxygenation to the brain and potentially increasing CO2 retention.
matrixMatch.rationaleNoChange: Maintaining the same level of consciousness would indicate no change.
